item.title: Kim add a quote by Robert McCloskey
item.description: "I know that you believe you understand what you think I said, but I'm not sure you realize that what you heard is not what I meant." -- Robert McCloskey

item.title: Kim add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "Dreams, you know, are what you wake up from." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Kim add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Kim add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description:
"since feeling is first who pays any attention to the syntax of things will never wholly kiss you;
wholly to be a fool while Spring is in the world
my blood approves, and kisses are a far better fate than wisdom lady i swear by all flowers. Don't cry --the best gesture of my brain is less than your eyelids' flutter which says
we are for eachother: then laugh, leaning back in my arms for life's not a paragraph
And death i think is no parenthesis" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Kim add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Kim add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Do I contradict myself? Very well, then, I contradict myself; I am large -- I contain multitudes." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Kim add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "It is like having a book out from the library. It is like constantly having a book out from the library." -- Lorrie Moore

item.title: Kim add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "This is what happened in love. One of you cried a lot and then both of you grew sarcastic." -- Lorrie Moore

item.title: Kim add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "Get in, get out. Don't linger. Go on." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Kim add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "I am too nervous to eat pie." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Kim add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Kim add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "I have no mission. No one has." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Kim add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kim add a quote by Kirk Curnutt
item.description: "There have been so many times I felt like I've ended the conversation lately I've decided that if I had a Wu Tang name it'd be Threadkilla. " -- Kirk Curnutt

item.title: Kim add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "I was reading the dictionary. I thought it was a poem about everything." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Kim add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I want words at my funeral. But I guess that means you need life in your life." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Kim add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Kim add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Kim add a quote by Carl Hiaasen
item.description: "Hey. Sometimes life is a shit flavored Popsicle." -- Carl Hiaasen

item.title: Kim add a quote by Richard Brautigan
item.description: "The bookstore was a parking lot for used graveyards. Thousands of graveyards were parked in rows like cars. Most of the books were out of print, and no one wanted to read them any more and the people who had read the books had died or forgotten about them, but through the organic process of music the books had become virgins again." -- Richard Brautigan

item.title: Kim add a quote by Kirk Curnutt
item.description: "sassysnacks!" -- Kirk Curnutt

item.title: Kim add a quote by Richard de Nooy
item.description: "Sometimes we encounter men, even entire families, whose gross ignorance, unappealing mien or reckless habits make us wonder how their genes have survived the trials and tribulations of the ages. Yet we do well to remember that, should the world be plunged into nuclear holocaust, the principal candidate for survival is neither man, nor the great elephant, nor the swift stallion, nor the wily fox – it is the lowly cockroach." -- Richard de Nooy

item.title: Kim add a quote by Kirk Curnutt
item.description: "My worst kiss could have been an outtake from Species. I think she thought my epiglottis was a punching bag." -- Kirk Curnutt

item.title: Kim add a quote by Kirk Curnutt
item.description: "Eating was a welcome distraction, not for us but for <i>them</i>. However the piles on the plates clashed (macaroni cheese sauce oozing orangely under the spinach salad), however sour the mixtures they made (runaway grapes rolling in the gravy!), our guests chewed to prove that their existence hadn't been diverted. For the price of a quick casserole, they bribed us into agreeing that this was God's plan, life was going on. Their cliches were breath mints: they wanted us to suck away to sweeten the bad taste our misfortune left in their mouths. And so we did." -- Kirk Curnutt

item.title: Kim add a quote by Charlie Schultz
item.description: "Sometimes I lie awake at night, and I ask, 'Where have I gone wrong'. Then a voice says to me, 'This is going to take more than one night." -- Charlie Schultz

item.title: Kim add a quote by Jessica Treat
item.description: "Kim's right of course" -- Jessica Treat

item.title: Kim add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "She wants to know if I love her, that's all anyone wants from anyone else, not love itself but the knowledge that love is there, like new batteries in the flashlight in the emergency kit in the hall closet." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Kim add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "We need enormous pockets, pockets big enough for our families and our friends, and even the people who aren't on our lists, people we've never met but still want to protect. We need pockets for boroughs and for cities, a pocket that could hold the universe." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Kim add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "We stopped laughing, I took the world into me, rearranged it, and sent it back out as a question: "Do you like me?" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Kim add a quote by e. e. cummings
item.description: "The world is mud-luscious and puddle-wonderful." -- e. e. cummings
